features: The INKEY List Glycolic Acid Toner. Reduce the appearance of pores, blackheads, and fine lines with this exfoliating toner that also gives skin a nice boost of radiance.
Smoother Skin for The Win. Derived from sugar cane, the toner works to remove dead skin on the surface and improve skin texture without drying it out.
Powerful Ingredients, Real Results. Glycolic Acid concentration keeps skin healthy and clear of blackheads and wrinkles while Witch Hazel minimizes excess oil.
How To Use It. Use AM & PM. After cleansing and hydrating, saturate a cotton pad with the toner and sweep across face and neck. No need to rinse off.
Your Needs, Our Knowledge. We believe that better knowledge powers better decisions. Skincare is a journey, and we are in it together.
body.description: This 10% Glycolic Acid exfoliator helps to reduce the appearance of pores, blackheads and fine lines, as well as support smoother and brighter skin. Derived from sugar cane, Glycolic Acid Toner works to remove dead skin on the surface to help improve the overall appearance of skin texture and brightness without drying out the skin. 5% Witch Hazel is included in our Glycolic Acid Toner to help reduce excess oil and soothe.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Glycolic Acid Toner Helps to: Reduce pore appearance Good for: Blemish prone / oily skin

This 10% Glycolic Acid exfoliating toner helps to reduce the appearance of pores and fine lines, as well as support smoother and brighter skin Derived from sugar cane, this Glycolic Acid unglues dead skin on the surface to help improve the overall appearance of skin texture and brightness. Formulated with 10% Glycolic Acid for maximum effect, and 5% Witch Hazel to help reduce excess oil and soothe. Recommended for those with oily or congested skin. KEY INGREDIENTS: • 10% glycolic acid concentration helps to keep skin healthy and clear of blackheads and fine lines • 5% witch hazel helps to minimize excess oil HOW TO USE: For use in the PM. After cleansing and Hyaluronic Acid if you are using it, saturate a cotton pad and wipe your face and neck. You can also use on other blemish-prone areas, including your back and chest. Follow with preferred serums and moisturizer. No need to rinse.

The INKEY List Salicylic Acid Cleanser The INKEY List Succinic Acid Blemish Treatment The INKEY List Oat Cleansing Balm The INKEY List Hyaluronic Acid The INKEY List Niacinamide Complete your recipe with Salicylic Acid Cleanser, a gentle exfoliating cleanser containing Salicylic Acid that can be used daily to help reduce blemishes, blackheads and reduced excess oil without drying the skin Succinic Acid Blemish Treatment, clear blemishes fast, reduce inflammation and prevent clogged pores with our non-drying, targeted treatment. With a cream formula, it is easily layered under makeup without drying or flaking This luxurious cleansing balm gently dissolves make-up, while cleansing and nourishing the skin, making it ideal for sensitive skin types Hyaluronic Acid works as a magnet for moisture, helping your cells retain as much of it as possible so that your skin feels and appears hydrated, plump and healthy Niacinamide, a 10% Niacinamide serum that helps to tackle the various side effects of spot prone skin, such as redness and excess oil to reduce the appearance of blemishes. Also formulated with Hyaluronic Acid to ensure skin stays hydrated

GOT A QUESTION? #ASKINKEY AHAS VS BHAS - WHAT’S THE DIFFERENCE? Alpha Hydroxy Acids (AHAs) are chemical exfoliators. Water-soluble, they work on the surface of your skin, encouraging cell turnover to reveal a brighter, more even complexion. Use in the PM and protect your skin with SPF during the day. Beta Hydroxy Acids (BHAs) are also chemical exfoliators. They are oil soluble, which means they work deeper in your pores, helping to target blackheads and reduce the bacteria that can lead to breakouts. Use AM or PM and protect your skin with SPF during the day. WHAT IS THE PH LEVEL OF THIS PRODUCT? PH LEVEL: 3.6-4.0 IS THIS PRODUCT VEGAN? This product contains no animal derivatives, however we are not yet vegan certified.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Doing the job effectively.
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this for a few weeks and I am happy with the result thus far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: So let me start off by saying I purchased this item in hopes I'd find a cheaper alternative to a product called Alpha-h liquid gold that I received in an Ipsy bag. I loved the Alpha-h glycolic acid liquid gold so much but it's not in my budget. I believe the same sized bottle as this product would cost at least 40 dollars. Let's be in honest, for a lot of us in today's economy that's a lot! So off to Amazon I went in hopes of an alternative. I have found it in this product. This isn't meant to be used as an every day toner. I use it one to two times a week. It doesn't sting or make my skin red. I do feel a very faint heat that clears within 1 minute. You should have a good moisturizer to use as well. It helps keep my skin clear and helps me get rid of blemishes also. It's not a miracle liquid, as my hormonal acne will still pop up often enough but it really has helped reduce scars and discoloration. It gives my face a more even and clear look. I love it, especially for the price and as a replacement for the more expensive liquid gold product. I believe it works just as well. Just don't overuse it and keep yourself moisturized. :) I will definitely be a repeat customer. :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Came a little damaged
reviews.reviewText: Came a little damaged but only the packaging. You need a moisturizer and sunscreen for this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great against odor
reviews.reviewText: After reading and seeing recommendations from dermatologists, I bought this. It is recommended to use this to get rid of the bacteria that makes a person smell, such as your underarms. If you are a woman, you know that the heat or working out creates smells that can make an individual feel uncomfortable. I used this under my breasts and between my thighs and let me say, it stops that smell. No it doesn't stop the sweat, but it gets rid of the bacteria that causes the smells. I have sensitive skin and this has not bothered it or created an issue for me. I feel better when I go to the gym or am outside in ridiculous heat. (Yes, I've used it outside of and around the lady bits and was still okay.) I recommend it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than The Ordinary
reviews.reviewText: Decided to give this a try since Ordinary raised their prices and since this is 10% I figured it should be a good swap. I’ve been using glycolic acid in lieu of deodorant for years and it works beautifully. Zero odor. This works even better than the ordinary and I feel like it actually keeps me from sweating as much but i’m not sure how that works. I’ll definitely keep using this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not for sensitive skin
reviews.reviewText: This made my skin angry, red, and bumpy after applying. It also stung a bit. My skin got very bumpy around my lips, as soon as I stopped using this product those bumps diminished.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Effective but expensive
reviews.reviewText: I switched over to this after using the Ordinary's glycolic acid toner for a year. I didn't look at the size before I bought it and was so surprised at how small it is compared to the Ordinary. But it does work better. I'm conflicted about whether to keep using it- I wish it were just a little more cost effective, AND I wish it came in more eco friendly packaging. I feel bad wasting a new plastic bottle every few months.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I am in my 30s and have problems with closed comedones (whiteheads) and occasional breakouts of several spots at a time, for a few years now. my skin is dry/oily combination.after using this product for the first time my skin started to purge in the area i usually get the larger spots, & most of my pores began to clear out. the purge hasn’t settled entirely yet, but on the rest of my face the skin tone looks more even & the number of whiteheads is drastically reduced.the overall tone of my skin is already much better & it’s a big relief to unclog those pores that nothing (and i mean nothing) has been able to fix until now. amazing. and i’ve only been using the product for a week.would love to know how other people got on.thank you - will definitely buy again soon!
El producto es pésimo, las manchas no se quitan. En consulta médica me han dado un líquido y si se ha quitado. Nada recomendable.

Da die Glykolsäure bei the Ordinary ständig nicht lieferbar ist, habe ich nach einer Alternative gesucht. Also ich kann sagen, dieses Produkt kann mit Leichtigkeit mithalten. Erkenne keinen Unterschied. Ist genauso perfekt für den Teint :) bin froh es gefunden zu haben !!! Wird somit immer wieder bestellt.
does its job, stinging at times but good. so far no complaints
Bin sehr enttäuscht. Das Fläschchen war schlecht zugeschraubt und ist daher fast komplett ausgelaufen. Was für eine Geldverschwendung!
